intro: Claytonia tolucana, commonly known as the Tolucan springbeauty, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, rocky habitats such as stream banks and meadows. The plant produces small, delicate flowers that are usually white or pale pink, with five petals and a distinctive yellow center. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in a fine layer of white, waxy hairs. Claytonia tolucana is well adapted to cool, wet environments and is often found in alpine or subalpine regions.
